sen.j: 方墳（ほうふん）とは墳丘の平面形が方形になる古墳のこと。
sen.e: A square barrow (called hofun in Japanese) is a kofun (tumulus), the plane surface of which is square-shaped.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: A square barrow is a kofun (tumulus) which planar shape is square-shaped.
A square barrow is a kofun (tumulus) which planar shape is square-shaped.

sen.j: 古墳時代の全期間にわたって円墳についで数多く築かれている。
sen.e: It is the shape that was built more frequently than any other form, next to a list of kofun-kofun forms, over the Kofun Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It was built over the Kofun period and most frequently next to a round barrow.
sen.cmt: 原文には 「古墳古墳の形式一覧」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「円墳」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: It was built over the Kofun period and most frequently next to a round barrow.

sen.j: 古墳時代初頭ないし前期に築かれるものは、弥生時代の大和風の方形周溝墓や出雲風の四隅突出型墳丘墓の延長と考えられる。
sen.e: The tumuli constructed from the beginning and the early phase of the Kofun Period are considered an extension of the Yamato-style square tombs that are surrounded by a moat and the Izumo-style tombs that are covered with a heap of earth, whose four corners are protruding outward, both of which were built in the Yayoi Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The tumuli constructed from the beginning and the early phase of the Kofun period are considered an extension of the Yamato-style square tombs with moat surrounding and the Izumo-style tombs covered with a heap of earth, whose four corners are protruding outward, both of which were built in the Yayoi period.

The tumuli constructed from the beginning and the early phase of the Kofun period are considered an extension of the Yamato-style square tombs with moat surrounding and the Izumo-style tombs covered with a heap of earth, whose four corners are protruding outward, both of which were built in the Yayoi period.

sen.j: 性格自体もほとんど変わらないとみなされている。
sen.e: Their characters are also taken to be nearly unchanged.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Their characters are also taken to be nearly unchanged.
Their characters are also taken to be nearly unchanged.

sen.j: だが、最近は、前方後円墳や土師器出現の時期を画期として、「方墳」の一種とみなされている
sen.e: However, they are now regarded as a kind of 'square barrows' as a result of the epoch-making appearance of keyhole-shaped tumuli and the Haji pottery.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, they are now regarded as a kind of 'square barrows' as a result of the epoch-making appearance of keyhole-shaped tumuli and the Haji pottery.
However, they are now regarded as a kind of 'square barrows' as a result of the epoch-making appearance of keyhole-shaped tumuli and the Haji pottery.

sen.j: そのため「前期群集墳」という造語まで発生している。
sen.e: Thus, even a coined term, 'the early-phase clustered tumuli,' has been created.
Thus, even a coined term, 'the early-phase clustered tumuli,' has been created.
Thus, even a coined term, 'the early-phase clustered tumuli,' has been created.

sen.j: 弥生時代の四隅突出型墳墓は、すでに古墳時代に作られる技術が多様に用いられている。
sen.e: A wealth of techniques already developed in the Kofun Period are used in the tombs protruding from the earth, whose four corners are extending outward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: A wealth of techniques already developed in the Kofun period is used in the tombs in Yayoi period which are covered with a heap of earth, whose four corners are protruding outward.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「弥生時代の」を補足し表現を変えました。
sen.e: A wealth of techniques already developed in the Kofun period is used in the tombs in Yayoi period which are covered with a heap of earth, whose four corners are protruding outward.

sen.j: このことから、古代出雲の技術を物語る。
sen.e: Hence, they show the techniques of ancient Izumo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Hence, they show the techniques of ancient Izumo.
Hence, they show the techniques of ancient Izumo.

sen.j: 前期方墳の代表例は、島根県安来市の大成古墳、造山古墳 (島根県)（1辺60m）。
sen.e: The representative examples of the early-phase square barrows include Onari-kofun Tumulus in Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture, and Tsukuriyama-kofun tumulus (whose sides are 60 meters long and that is in Shimane Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The representative examples of the early-phase square barrows include Onari-kofun Tumulus in Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture, and Tsukuriyama-kofun Tumulus (whose sides are 60 meters long and that is in Shimane Prefecture).

The representative examples of the early-phase square barrows include Onari-kofun Tumulus in Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture, and Tsukuriyama-kofun Tumulus (whose sides are 60 meters long and that is in Shimane Prefecture).

sen.j: これらが全国最大の規模を誇る。
sen.e: They are the largest in the country
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: They are the larger than any other tumuli in the country.
They are the larger than any other tumuli in the country.

sen.j: その他方墳も出雲に集中している。
sen.e: Other square barrows are also concentrated in Izumo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Other square barrows are also concentrated in Izumo.
Other square barrows are also concentrated in Izumo.

sen.j: そして、前方後方墳の魁もみられる。
sen.e: There are also harbingers of front-quadrilateral rear-square-shaped tumuli.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: There are also prototypes of square front, square back mounds.
There are also prototypes of square front, square back mounds.

sen.j: 比較的小型のものが多い。
sen.e: Most square barrows are relatively small.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Most square barrows are relatively small.
Most square barrows are relatively small.

sen.j: しかし、前方後円墳の築造が停止する7世紀には有力者の古墳の墳形に採用されている。
sen.e: However, they were adopted as the shape of the tumuli of the influential persons by the seventh century, in which the construction of keyhole-shaped tumuli was stopped.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, they were adopted as the shape of the tumuli of the influential persons by the seventh century, in which the construction of keyhole-shaped tumuli was stopped.
However, they were adopted as the shape of the tumuli of the influential persons by the seventh century, in which the construction of keyhole-shaped tumuli was stopped.

sen.j: 例としては現在、用明天皇陵に指定されている大阪春日向山古墳（辺長63m×60m）や、推古天皇陵に指定されている山田高塚古墳（辺長63m×56m）、蘇我馬子の墓と考えられている石舞台古墳（上円下方墳との説あり）、千葉県の龍角寺岩屋古墳（辺長80m、高さ13m）などがある。
sen.e: Examples today include Kasuga Mukaiyama-kofun Tumulus (with the side lengths of 63 and 60 meters) specified as the mausoleum of Emperor Yomei.amada Takatsuka Tumulus (with the side lengths of 63 and 56 meters) specified as the mausoleum of Empress Suiko, Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus (with a competing view that it is a tumulus, which has a dome-shaped mound on a square base) believed to be the tomb of SOGA no Umako, and Ryukakuji Iwaya-kofun Tumulus (with the side lengths of 80 meters and the height of 13 meters) in Chiba Prefecture.

Examples include followings: Osaka Kasuga Mukaiyama-kofun Tumulus (with the side lengths of 63 and 60 meters) specified as the mausoleum of Emperor Yomei.amada Takatsuka-kofun Tumulus (with the side lengths of 63 and 56 meters) specified as the mausoleum of Empress Suiko, Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus (with a competing view that it is a dome-shaped mound on a square base) believed to be the tomb of SOGA no Umako, and Ryukakuji Iwaya-kofun Tumulus in Chiba Prefecture (with the side lengths of 80 meters and the height of 13 meters).

Examples include followings: Osaka Kasuga Mukaiyama-kofun Tumulus (with the side lengths of 63 and 60 meters) specified as the mausoleum of Emperor Yomei.amada Takatsuka-kofun Tumulus (with the side lengths of 63 and 56 meters) specified as the mausoleum of Empress Suiko, Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus (with a competing view that it is a dome-shaped mound on a square base) believed to be the tomb of SOGA no Umako, and Ryukakuji Iwaya-kofun Tumulus in Chiba Prefecture (with the side lengths of 80 meters and the height of 13 meters).

sen.j: また、島根県東部の出雲地方は方墳が特に多い地域として知られている。
sen.e: The Izumo region in the eastern part of Shimane Prefecture is also known as a region where there are particularly a large number of square barrows.
The Izumo region in the eastern part of Shimane Prefecture is also known as a region where particularly a large number of square barrows were located.
The Izumo region in the eastern part of Shimane Prefecture is also known as a region where particularly a large number of square barrows were located.
